It is Ozyorsk (Ozersk), located in the Chelyabinsk Oblast, one of the most polluted places on the planet and home to the largest stockpiles of nuclear material. Its code name: City 40.","popularity":3.359,"poster_path":"/dGxangZ64jKe9uHo5sYYJu4zlzM.jpg","release_date":"2016-04-28","title":"City 40","video":false,"vote_average":6.321,"vote_count":42},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":395499,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Real Boy","overview":"REAL BOY is the coming-of-age story of Bennett Wallace, a transgender teenager on a journey to find his voice-as a musician, a friend, a son, and a man. As he navigates the ups and downs of young adulthood, Bennett works to gain the love and support of his mother, who has deep misgivings about her child's transition. Along the way, he forges a powerful friendship with his idol, Joe Stevens, a celebrated transgender musician with his own demons to fight.","popularity":0.787,"poster_path":"/5azv4TWSYICwa1yZLKFs9ZFdXhX.jpg","release_date":"2016-03-21","title":"Real Boy","video":false,"vote_average":5.0,"vote_count":8},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99,10770],"id":395530,"original_language":"de","original_title":"Kenneth Anger: Film als magisches Ritual","overview":"Anger discusses his Aleister Crowley-inspired theories of art: How he views his camera like a wand and how he casts his films, preferring to consider his actors, not human beings but as elemental spirits. In fact, he reveals that he goes so far as to use astrology when making these choices.  This is as direct an explanation of Anger’s cinemagical modus operandi as I have ever heard him articulate anywhere. It’s a must see for anyone interested in his work and showcases the Magus of cinema at the very height of his artistic powers. Fascinating. (Dangerous Minds)","popularity":1.523,"poster_path":"/gsA8J9HFsXUNzzHOGgzqivEOys5.jpg","release_date":"1970-04-29","title":"Kenneth Anger: Film as Magical Ritual","video":false,"vote_average":5.7,"vote_count":3},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/pQQtcnZnJ1ZVwNi4Wn7iRm7iTF6.jpg","genre_ids":[99],"id":396124,"original_language":"en","original_title":"We The People 2.0","overview":"American citizens who are normally marginalized, forgotten and left to fend against toxic dumps and other violations, come to understand that the only way to survive and save their communities is to challenge the system head-on.","popularity":7.785,"poster_path":"/zsa10bzffzSSpMwGYEs64bJ5ECO.jpg","release_date":"2016-06-11","title":"We The People 2.0","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":396133,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Energy War","overview":"Documentary feature. 16mm; color; sound.","popularity":1.245,"poster_path":"/9vUpQTLGl9tDXdEVSiHI1GVgO1U.jpg","release_date":"1977-01-01","title":"Energy War","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":396142,"original_language":"en","original_title":"In Paraguay","overview":"Documentary film by Ross McElwee.","popularity":0.592,"poster_path":null,"release_date":"2008-09-01","title":"In Paraguay","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/69QqSrhnfZVUQPUIRC322AZyJXa.jpg","genre_ids":[99],"id":396172,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Angry Inuk","overview":"With \"sealfies\" and social media, a new tech-savvy generation of Inuit is wading into the world of activism, using humour and reason to confront aggressive animal rights vitriol and defend their traditional hunting practices.  Director Alethea Arnaquq-Baril joins her fellow Inuit activists as they challenge outdated perceptions of Inuit and present themselves to the world as a modern people in dire need of a sustainable economy.","popularity":6.013,"poster_path":"/uJBPEKGSAb8IsFyK5EZJKcXbCXJ.jpg","release_date":"2016-05-02","title":"Angry Inuk","video":false,"vote_average":7.4,"vote_count":11},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":396217,"original_language":"sv","original_title":"13 Related Sewing Machines","overview":"Why can't I hear the sound of sewing machines anymore? A meeting with my family and the history of all their sewing machines.","popularity":0.864,"poster_path":null,"release_date":"2011-03-04","title":"13 Related Sewing Machines","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":229695,"original_language":"pt","original_title":"Sou Feia Mas Tô na Moda","overview":"Documentary about the musical and social phenomenon of Brazilian funk (or Carioca Funk), a style derived from Miami Bass, based on repetitive bass drum loops and lyrics full of sexual and violent overtones, not directly related to American funk/soul music. This style emerged in the slums and poor neighborhoods of Rio de Janeiro, and is deeply associated with the lower social classes, but is gradually being accepted on higher social circles. The film is specially interested in women's participation, focusing on its major female stars.","popularity":1.976,"poster_path":null,"release_date":"2005-12-16","title":"I'm Ugly But Trendy","video":false,"vote_average":5.3,"vote_count":3},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":862019,"original_language":"en","original_title":"If You Build It: 30 Years of Field of Dreams","overview":"More than just a baseball movie, Academy Award®-nominated \"Field of Dreams\" is an enduring story of family, resilience and hope. This documentary looks at how the film was made and explores the themes that continue to resonate with audiences 32 years later. Features interviews with actors Timothy Busfield, Frank Whaley, and Dwier Brown, producer Larry Gordon, and FOX Sports' lead MLB play-by-play announcer Joe Buck.","popularity":2.916,"poster_path":"/p9ZyeinGSJrxNC0VxL1B1EYrMJj.jpg","release_date":"2021-08-07","title":"If You Build It: 30 Years of Field of Dreams","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/7f6OExJlPDYf5UPTjtIOCythZun.jpg","genre_ids":[99],"id":1180493,"original_language":"en","original_title":"The Complete Story of Film","overview":"At 18 hours and 43 minutes long, 'The Complete Story of Film' collects two epic documentaries by Mark Cousins into a stunningly expansive global journey through film history from the birth of cinema to today. The Story of Film: An Odyssey is an inclusive and ground-breaking journey through the history of world cinema and a treat for movie lovers around the globe. Guided by filmmaker and historian Mark Cousins, this wonderfully insightful 15-hour love letter to the movies begins with the invention of motion pictures at the end of the 19th century, continuing through the entire 20th century of moviemaking and concluding with the globalized digital industry of the 21st. In The Story of Film: A New Generation, Cousins picks up where Odyssey left off, returning with a new epic and hopeful tale of modern cinematic innovation in the new millennium, exploring how movies and moviegoing have evolved and will continue to transform to our collective joy and wonder.","popularity":1.845,"poster_path":"/bJw6vLP9KsSeO3W8iYPNurO3bLu.jpg","release_date":"2023-08-29","title":"The Complete Story of Film","video":false,"vote_average":8.0,"vote_count":1},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":230849,"original_language":"en","original_title":"The Last Impresario","overview":"Michael White might just be the most famous person you’ve never heard of. A notorious London theatre and film impresario, he produced over 300 shows and movies over the last 50 years. Bringing to the stage the risqué productions of Oh! Calcutta!, The Rocky Horror Show and to the screen Monty Python’s The Holy Grail, as well as introducing Merce Cunningham, Pina Bausch and Yoko Ono to London audiences, he irrevocably shaped the cultural scene of the 1970s London. Playboy, gambler, bon vivant, friend of the rich and famous, he is now in his eighties and still enjoys partying like there’s no tomorrow. In this intimate documentary, filmmaker Gracie Otto introduces us to this larger-than-life phenomenon. Featuring interviews with 50 of his closest friends including Anna Wintour, Kate Moss, John Waters and Barry Humphries and, of course, the man himself, Otto pays a vibrant tribute to a fascinating entertainer.","popularity":1.234,"poster_path":"/jaiFC6IfGRL1cEwB1FQzy1WNKdP.jpg","release_date":"2013-10-12","title":"The Last Impresario","video":false,"vote_average":5.5,"vote_count":4},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":230867,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Taşkafa, Stories of the Street","overview":"Taşkafa is a real dog and also a legend on the streets of Istanbul. John Berger begins Taşkafa’s story, reading from his novel, King, the story of the disappearance of a community told from a dog’s perspective. The area’s ordinary people – taxi drivers, shopkeepers, street traders – care deeply about the welfare of the city’s street dogs and they tell us stories about Taşkafa and their other canine neighbours. The animals are a symbol of community living, where people (and dogs) look out for each other, but this is a community in transition; one from which dogs are starting to be expelled. Eccentric, amusing and very warm, the film is a powerful indictment of the impact of global politics and the economic appropriation of public space but, even more, it is a tribute to both the spirit of resistance and to city life that can accommodate people and dogs together.","popularity":0.584,"poster_path":"/lBLmyycslRhy0XH9ToPoTS0Lw2v.jpg","release_date":"2013-10-15","title":"Taşkafa, Stories of the Street","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":399227,"original_language":"pt","original_title":"Abigail","overview":"Abigail connects the dots of a human map that links the indigenous Amazon cultures to Afro-Brazilian religions.
